Description: Two rim fragments of an Egyptian(izing) glazed composition (faience) 'common bowl'; mould-made or -pressed and covered with a blue glaze and brown painted decoration; hemispherical body and rounded rim; the painted decoration seems to depict the front parts and head of a four-legged animal against a floral background, framed by a broad hatched border; dots and oblique strokes on the rim.
Curator's comments: See E. Peltenburg, 'Hathor, faience and copper on Late Bonrze Age Cyprus', CCEC 37 (2007), 375-394 on the Egyptian 'common bowl' on Cyprus.
Bibliographic references: Malmgren 2003 / Klavdhia-Tremithos. A Middle and Late Cypriote Bronze Age site. (no. 150, p. 56)
Jacobsson 1994 / Aegyptiaca from Late Bronze Age Cyprus (No. 199)
Kiely 2011d / Klavdia-Tremithos: A Bronze Age community in south-east Cyprus (M.6)
